newsitem.title: JAPAN: U.S. still hopeful of N. Korea peace talks.
newsitem.headline: U.S. still hopeful of N. Korea peace talks.

text.p: Despite recent setbacks, the United States remains hopeful that communist North Korea will take part in Korean Peninsula peace talks, a U.S. official said on Thursday.

The official, who asked not to be identified, said the size of food aid to famine-hit North Korea remained the main sticking point to opening talks involving China, South Korea, the United States and North Korea.
The official made the comments while briefing reporters about talks in Tokyo on Wednesday between officials from the United States, South Korea and Japan aimed at coordinating policy on North Korea.
"The United States is still hopeful of a positive answer in due course to (proposals for) peace talks," the official said.
At talks in New York two weeks ago, North Korea turned down proposals to join negotiations aimed at finally closing the book on the 1950-53 Korean War, which ended in a now-fraying armistice.

Talks also broke down earlier this week between the Red Cross organisations of the two Koreas aimed at stepping up food supplies to North Korea, where harvests have been devastated by two consecutive years of record floods.
